text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Arcadia 2001 is an 8-bit console developed by Emerson released in 1982, in competition against the Atari 5200 and Intellivision. Over thirty variants/clones were released, most notably Bandai's Arcadia with four exclusive games including Dr. Slump. It has a Signetics 2650 CPU clocked at 1.2MHz and 1KB of RAM. It can display a resolution of 128x104 in monochrome or 128x104 at 9 colors and up to 4 sprites simultaneously. A beeper produces the sounds for the game. Counting all variants, its library reaches 47 games.
